Generation III.Ruby: Lombre is nocturnal - it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief-maker. When this Pok é mon spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
Generation III.Sapphire: Lombre 's entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pok é mon 's hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.
Generation III.Emerald: In the evening, it takes great delight in popping out of rivers and startling people. It feeds on aquatic moss that grows on rocks in the riverbed.
Generation III.FireRed: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

Generation IV.Diamond: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

Generation IV.Platinum: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Old folklore in Kitakami tells of a mischievous child who was reborn as a Pokémon.
Generation IX.Violet: It prefers waterfronts with plentiful food. It becomes nocturnal so it wouldn't have to compete for food with bird Pokémon.
